author: Staff Reporter
text:
District Collector S. Jayandhi on Friday opened the shutter of Thirumoorthy Dam to release water into Parambikulam Main Canal to irrigate 94,521 acres of agriculture land spread over Tirupur, and Coimbatore districts.

PWD (Water Resources Organisation) officials told The Hindu that two more shutters will be opened either on Saturday or Sunday to release water to Udumalpet and high level canals.

Water was discharged at the rate of 500 cusecs into the Parambikulam canal to facilitate the irrigation of the agriculture lands falling under Zone-I of the command area of the dam. The water level at the dam site was 46.5 ft against the maximum height of 60 ft at 5 p.m on Friday.

Officials said that the water would be released in three 'wetting cycles' with each cycle spanning over 20 days with a gap of five to seven days in between the cycles.

The water would be released through Udumalpet and high level canals too in three wetting cycles with each cycle spread over 15 days.

“The inflow of water into the dam is mainly through River Palar,” said the officials.
title: Water released from Thirumoorthy dam
